p: Previous data suggest that mutations in the main causative genes of primary HLH (such as gene encoding for perforin) were also associated with secondary HLH/MAS [ 99]. There are also other mutations in other genes such as NLRC4 associated with rare monogenic autoinflammatory diseases causing a tendency to recurrent MAS. NLRC4-related disease is characterized by early-onset recurrent fever, enterocolitis, and repeated episodes of MAS [ 100]. Patients carrying variants of these genes may also be more prone to cytokine storm associated with COVID-19. Future data about the course of COVID-19 in the setting of rare monogenic autoinflammatory diseases will provide further insights about the disease pathogenesis.
